page.title: 13HOUSING
page.content: More than half the area was formerly taken up by Calke & Staunton Harold private estates. This has meant almost no building other than farmhouses, lodges to estates, gamekeepers' cottages & cottages for other estate workers has taken place over the past 200 years. Most of these, now renovated, have passed into private hands. In style the cottages follow a similar architectural pattern using timber, stone & narrow brick - all three in some cases, with slate roofs,except for three which are attractively thatched. Being within or on the perimeter of parkland,they stand in ideal rural settings, & all the occupants state that they would not live anywhere else.
